title.narrative: FAO resilience rapid respons Burkina Faso 2018-2022
FAO resilience rapid respons Burkina Faso 2018-2022

description.narrative:
Project name: "Réponse d’urgence et appui à l’amélioration de la résilience des populations vulnérables dans les zones à risque du Burkina Faso 2018-2021" ("Urgent response aiming at strengthening the resilience of vulnerabe households in risk zones in Burkina Faso 2018-2020"). The FAO project code is OSRO/BKF/801/SWE.
Agreement partner and implementor: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), United Nations
In Burkina Faso, poor rainfall distributions in recent years have reduced the area of cereal crops and the income generated by agriculture The joint SAP-GTP mission in October 2017 counted 83 municipalities at risk. Thus, the current crop year 2017-2018 cereal production was estimated to have decreased with 12% compared to the average for the last five years.
The project reaches 28,000 poor and very poor households (according to the HEA classification) in the coverage regions, all of whom will benefit from the unconditional cash transfer during the lean season. In addition to unconditional cash transfer, 4100 self-selected households will have the opportunity to enroll in the «Cash for Work" activities (i.e. rehabilitation of communal infrastructures) during the mitigation and recovery period. Moreover, according to their main livelihoods, all households (HH) will receive productive assets: 2800 HH cereal production, 2500 HH small livestock restocking (sheep, goats, poultry, pigs depending on the choice), 1900 HH with livestock feed coupons and 2500 HH for market gardening coupled with nutritious gardens to strengthen their resilience. All targeted households (10 000) will also benefit from a nutritional education/sensitization programme.
Among the targeted beneficiaries, special emphasis will be placed on women and young people in order to take into account their specific needs.
Development objective: The resilience of vulnerable pastoralists and agro-pastoralists to climate and economic shocks is improved. The initial agreement had an activity period from 1 June 2018 to 31 May 2020 and a budget of 79 million SEK. The agreement was amended at end 2019 with a budget increase up to 129 million SEK. A second amendment was made at end 2020 with an extension of the activity period to 31 December 2021 and a budget increase up to the total of 189 million SEK. The amendments are justified by the dramatic increase of need for support to the local population due the worsened security situation and the increase of the number of internally displaced people to more than one million.

Projektnamn: "Réponse d'urgence et appui à l'amélioration de la résilience des populations vulnérables dans les zones à risque du Burkina Faso 2018-2021" ("Akut svar för att stärka moståndskraften hos utsatta hushåll i riskzoner i Burkina Faso 2018-2021"). FAO:s projektkod är OSRO/BKF/801/SWE.
Avtalspartner och genomförare: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), FN
I Burkina Faso har den i tid och rum ojämnt spridda nederbörden under de senaste åren minskat den odlade arealen och den inkomst som genereras av jordbruket. Det gemensamma SAP-GTP-uppdraget i oktober 2017 klassade 83 kommuner i riskzonen för matosäkerhet och visade att skörden 2017-2018 minskade med 12% jämfört med genomsnittet för de senaste fem åren.
Det aktuella FAO-projektet bistår ca 28000 fattiga och mycket fattiga hushåll (enligt HEA-klassificeringen) i det täckta området, vilka alla kommer att dra nytta av överföringen av "unconditional cash" under de svåra månaderna före skörd. Förutom "unconditional cash" kommer 4100 hushåll ha möjlighet att anmäla sig till aktiviteterna "Cash for Work" (dvs. rehabilitering av kommunala infrastrukturer) under höst och torrperiod. Dessutom kommer hushållens egna produktiva kapacitet att stärkas genom utdelning av "produktions-kits": 2800 kits för spannmålsproduktion, 2500 kits för uppfödning av boskap (får, getter, fjäderfä, grisar beroende på valet), 1900 hushåll får djurfoderkuponger och 2500 hushåll får stöd i grönsaksodling för att stärka nutrition och motståndskraft. Alla hushåll i målgruppen kommer också att dra nytta av utbildning i nutrition.
Utvecklingsmål: De sårbara pastoralisternas och agro-pastoralisternas motståndskraft mot klimat och ekonomiska chocker förbättras. Det initiala avtalet mellan ambassaden och FAO sträckte sig fram till 31 maj 2020 för en budget om 79 miljoner kr. Hösten 2019 ökades budgeten till 129 miljoner kr. Hösten 2020 ökades den ytterligare till 189 miljoner kr och aktivitetsperioden förlängdes till 31 december 2021. Skälet till budgetökningen var det dramatiskt ökade behovet av stöd till befolkningen i norra landet pga den tilltagande säkerhetskrisen och den stora ökningen av internflyktingar (drygt en miljon under hösten 2020).

Utvecklingsmål
Motståndskraften mot klimatchocker och ekonomiska chocker hos sårbara boskapsskötare och agro-pastoralister har förbättrats.
Specifika mål: 1. Sårbara hushåll har förbättrad tillgång till mat och försörjning 2. Försörjningsförmågan hos sårbara agro-sylvo-pastorala hushåll i krisdrabbade provinser har återställts 3. De sårbara hushållens näringsstatus i krisdrabbade provinser i Burkina Faso har förbättrats

tag.narrative: 13.1 - Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters in all countries.
13.1 - Stärka motståndskraften mot och förmågan till anpassning till klimatrelaterade faror och naturkatastrofer i alla länder.
2.1 - By 2030, end hunger and ensure access by all people, in particular the poor and people in vulnerable situations, including infants, to safe, nutritious and sufficient food all year round.

2.1 - Senast 2030 avskaffa hunger och garantera alla människor, i synnerhet de fattiga och människor i utsatta situationer, inklusive små barn, tillgång till tillräckligt med säker och näringsrik mat året om.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
Results 1: Vulnerable households improved their access to food and means of production
Activities included unconditional cash support to 11 500 new vulnerable households (both host and IDP families), cash for work support to 4 736 households, participation in the joint State-Partner market monitoring mission and following report on the functionality of markets to protect livelihoods and written ToRs for four (4) post-distribution monitoring studies.
Result 2: The agro-sylvo-pastoral production capital of vulnerable households in the provinces heavily affected by the crisis is restored
Activities included distribution of animal feed and veterinary services and vaccinations to vulnerable households, support for production of animal feed, mowing and conservation of natural feed, construction of hay lofts, production of vegetable gardens and supply of food production kits for improved access and valorisation of food products.
Result 3: The nutritional situation of vulnerable households in the provinces heavily affected by the crisis in Burkina Faso is improved
Distribution material on good nutritional and food hygiene practices and provide information, education and communication actions on the causes and good practices to prevent malnutrition of children and pregnant women.
Some effects of the project are:
- The support for the production of feed for livestock provides the opportunity to have available feed for animals at the appropriate time, but also to strengthen the productive capacities of households. - The provision of organic fertilizer created better quality of the soil, which enabled the crops to better resist the various pockets of drought. Beneficiaries have now started to use organic fertilizer as a method for improved soil quality. - Supporting women for chickpea production contributes to the empowerment of young women. The production will valuable support for improving the nutritional status of households, but also provide very important income to women for the well-being of the whole family. - The support in improved rice seeds and mineral fertilizer has been of great benefit to the beneficiaries who hope to harvest will both cover the rice needs of host/IDP families, but also generate a surplus for sale, in order to improve their income.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
